result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Donald Udeen

defendant.name: Udeen, Jonathan Donald
defendant.address: 11520 S Roos Rd, Solon Springs, WI 54873

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Defendant Jonathan Donald Udeen in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jonathan Donald Udeen.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF155, 22TR1266, 1265, 1264, and 1263. State asks for another status to allow time to confer with client.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Jonathan Donald Udeen in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jonathan Donald Udeen.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hoffman received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Asks for a status conference in October. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.pdf
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
09:04 am Defendant Jonathan Donald Udeen in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for Jonathan Donald Udeen.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Jesse Jarrell- sworn and testifies. Deputy for Douglas County Sheriff. Describes training and experience. Relates traffic incident. Witness identifies defendant.
Att Hoffman cross examines.
State provides Exhibit #1 Certified Driving Record(M-O-R). Reviews incidents of prior alcohol incidents.
State rests
Att Hoffman- no witnesses
State makes argument, moves for bind over
Att Hoffman- opposes bind over
Court finds probable cause for bind over, sets arraignment date
Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license or IID.  No use or possession of alcohol.

1:35 PM Defendant Jonathan Donald Udeen appeared by video, in custody.  Michael Charles Hoffman appears with Defendant. Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Address verified. Receives complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Asks for preliminary hearing. Court accepts plea. 
State requests $750 cash. Prior conviction for contempt of court. Concerned about nature of charges. Conditions of no use of alcohol, no driving without valid permit or license or IID. Cites prior FTA's. 
Hoffman indicates lifelong resident of Douglas County. Made his appearances on signature bonds. No money to post. Asks for higher signature bond.
Court orders $750 cash, conditions of no driving without valid license or permit, no use of alcohol.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:15 am.
